intro: Comesperma latifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf comesperma, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white powdery coating. It produces small, white or pinkish flowers that appear in clusters, typically during the spring and summer months. The species is adapted to a range of environmental conditions, including sandy soils and dry climates.
